news.title: Wispr Flow launches an Android app for AI-powered dictation
news.summary: AI-powered dictation startup Wispr Flow has launched its Android app today. The company released its app for Mac and Windows first, then launched on iOS in June 2025. news.title: Apple might take a new approach to announcing its next products
news.summary: Apple has invited the tech press to a “special Apple experience” on March 4, but it might unfold a bit differently than the company's standard press event.

news.title: Can the creator economy stay afloat in a flood of AI slop?
news.summary: On the latest episode of Equity, we debated what’s next for the creator economy, and whether there will be any room for the next generation of creators to stand out.

news.title: Bill Gurley says that right now, the worst thing you can do for your career is play it safe
news.summary: "The number one thing is to get out of your head this ideal that gets passed around in the self-help world: 'go get a mentor,' and everyone runs out and cold calls someone that's ridiculously too high and unachievable, and it doesn't work."

news.title: Quantonation’s double-sized second fund shows quantum still has believers
news.summary: Quantonation Ventures, a venture firm investing in quantum and physics-based startups, has closed its oversubscribed second fund at €220 million, or approximately $260 million. news.title: Taara Beam provides 25Gbps connectivity over invisible beams of light
news.summary: Light-based internet provider Taara, which spun out of Alphabet's "moonshot" incubator last year, just launched Taara Beam to provide 25Gbps connectivity within cities over invisible beams of light - line of sight permitting. news.title: Samsung is adding Perplexity to Galaxy AI
news.summary: In addition to summoning Bixby or Gemini, Galaxy S26 users will be able to call on Perplexity by saying "hey, Plex." news.title: Trump says Netflix will ‘pay the consequences’ if it doesn’t fire Susan Rice
news.summary: Donald Trump threatened that there would be "consequences" for Netflix if it didn't fire board member Susan Rice. news.title: NASA Delays Launch of Artemis II Lunar Mission Once Again
news.summary: A failure in the helium flow of the SLS rocket has prompted NASA to delay the Artemis II moon mission. Rather than March 6, the launch is now targeted for April.
